posts.post_content:
He's not too terrible, guys. Give him a break. In limited, he's an early 1/1, who can probably get in for 1 or 2 points of damage before becoming a chump blocker. Late game, he drops and can pump up to a 4/1 and swing with your team for a significant source of damage that has to be blocked. Flexibility is something many people overlook.  
  
3/5
posts.html:

Late game, he drops and can pump up to a 4/1 and swing with your team for a significant source of damage that has to be blocked. Flexibility is something many people overlook.

Posted By: Ghostmyth (9/28/2012 5:56:43 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This lil' guy is cute and makes me want to build a Lizard tribal deck with [Skitter of Lizards](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skitter of Lizards). I won't though. This card is good, don't get me wrong, and I've always dreamed of a one-drop with fire-breathing. Sadly, now that it's here, it's a little underwhelming compared with [Typhoid Rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Typhoid Rats), a legitimate turn one threat. It might find a place in Pauper, but still.. the 1R cost is a tad much.
posts.html:
